When I unchecked the "Enable OSGi runtime support" preference, it stopped
happening. Re-enabling it did not make the bug happen again. Can't reproduce it
anymore.

That checkbox is in a 'Work in Progress' page for a reason :-).

There are still issues with the new code that does not make it suitable for 
general consumtion, and you just found one of them :-).
